alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Dawson; Forsyth; North Fulton; Pickens (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 2:12PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cherokee, Forsyth, southwestern Dawson, northeastern Fulton and southeastern Pickens Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 211 PM EDT, a cluster of strong thunderstorms was located near Reavis Mountain, or 12 miles southwest of Dawsonville, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, pea sized hail and frequent cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cumming, Johns Creek, Alpharetta, Ball Ground, Nelson, Free Home, Drew, Marblehill, Coal Mountain, Brookwood, Hightower, Matt, Hollis Lathem Reservoir, Holbrook, Lathemtown, Ducktown, Tate and Reavis Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.

area.areaDesc: Cherokee; Dawson; Forsyth; North Fulton; Pickens
